title: Is buying a new Introduction to Algorithms, Second Edition book for $10 considered a mistake? - Quora
tags: Introduction to Algorithms (book by Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest and Stein)

response.answer_text: Honestly, I hadn't had the book in the hands, but I had a quick look at Wikipedia description.I don't know what was added / corrected in the 3rd edition, but I bet the 2nd one was already a very useful text book, introducing many useful algorithms and data structures, like hashes, trees, string searching, etc.These are fundamental in our industry, and understanding them is a must.So, I think that even an "old" edition can do the job to teach them.Later, when you will be more experienced (and wealthy, with a job!), you might buy the 3rd (or 4th!) edition and learn some new things or deepen some knowledge. :-)
